thread.title: Rangers' Beltre leaves playoff game with stiff back
thread.title_full: Rangers' Beltre leaves playoff game with stiff back

title: Rangers' Beltre leaves playoff game with stiff back
text:
Updated: 4:51 p.m. Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015 | Posted: 4:51 p.m. Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015 Rangers' Beltre leaves playoff game with stiff back Related View Larger Toronto Blue Jays' shortstop Troy Tulowitzki forces out Texas Rangers' Adrian Beltre at second base before throwing to first base for the double play during the first inning in Game 1 of an American League Division Series in Toronto on Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015. (Frank Gunn/The Canadian Press via AP) View Larger Toronto Blue Jays' shortstop Troy Tulowitzki forces Texas Rangers' Adrian Beltre at second base before throwing to first base for the double play during the first inning in Game 1 of baseballs American League Division Series in Toronto on Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015. (Nathan Denette/The Canadian Press via AP) Sponsored Links The Associated Press TORONTO â€” 
Texas Rangers third baseman Adrian Beltre left Thursday's AL Division Series opener against the Toronto Blue Jays in the third inning after hurting his back on a slide. 
Beltre could hardly run to first base after hitting an RBI single in the top half of the inning, and received attention from the trainer at first base. 
After Prince Fielder's inning-ending groundout, Beltre tried jogging to his position at third base but came out of the game, in obvious pain. Beltre appeared to be wiping away tears as he was helped off the field and into the dugout. He was replaced by Hanser Alberto. 
Rangers spokesman John Blake said Beltre had lower back stiffness caused by a slide into second base as Prince Fielder hit into an inning-ending double play in the first. 
Beltre hit .287 with 18 homers and 87 RBIs this season. His two-out single in the third gave the Rangers a 2-0 lead over David Price and the Blue Jays. Copyright The Associated Press Sign up for our WFTV Morning News Headlines Newsletter Sign Up
